modules.description: Provides functions to create and manipulate monotonic and system time sources, including getting the current time, calculating durations, and converting between time representations. Works with custom data types for time intervals and timestamps, tailored for precise timing in network and system applications. Used to synchronize events in untrusted environments and measure elapsed time in MirageOS-based projects.

Provides operations to disconnect from a clock source, retrieve the current time in days and picoseconds, obtain the local time zone offset in seconds, and query the clock's period in days and picoseconds. Works with Lwt-based asynchronous operations and a unit type representing the clock interface. Used to synchronize applications with system time, handle time zone adjustments, and manage clock drift in networked or embedded systems.
